Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
Interest chart here. Various strikers over/under performance against their xG since 2014/15:
https://ibb.co/wwD40qZ
Confirms what I’ve been saying for a while that Dybala is an amazing finisher even though some down rate this ability of his.
For the Juve players it reads:
1. Dybala +18%
2. Higuain +9%
3. Ronaldo +5%.
Lots of other interesting player results in there.

so much this

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
If you were named sporting director how would you set about saving Juve from financial ruin while also fielding a championship-caliber lineup?
Out:
Cristiano Ronaldo (probably the 2nd or 3rd hardest player on the roster to try to score a capital gain on a transfer)
Gonzalo Higuain (he is the other player in that 2nd or 3rd mix, the River Plate deal similar to the Tevez-Boca deal might be the best option)
Douglas Costa
Marko Pjaca
Miralem Pjanic
Aaron Ramsey
Sami Khedira
Alex Sandro
Mattia De Sciglio
Leonardo Bonucci
Daniele Rugani
Mattia Perin
In (my first and second option for each spot):
Timo Werner/Gabriel Jesus
Alexander Isak/Nicolas Gonzalez
Adil Aouchiche/Jonathan David
Filip Kostic/Gaetano Castrovilli
Niclas Eliasson/Luis Sinisterra
Baptiste Santamaria/Mikel Merino
Teun Koopmeiners/Manuel Locatelli
Dejan Kulusevski/Christopher Nkunku
Sergio Reguilon/Anthony Caci
Luca Pellegrini
Tanguy Kouassi/Lorenzo Pirola
Nordi Mukiele/Achraf Hakimi
4-4-2
Werner/Isak
Dybala/Aouchiche
Kostic/Eliasson/Matuidi
Santamaria/Rabiot
Bentancur/Koopmeiners
Kulusevski/Bernardeschi
Reguilon/Pellegrini
Chiellini/Kouassi
de Ligt/Demiral
Mukiele/Cuadrado/Danilo
Szczesny/Buffon/Pinsoglio
Salary bloat fixed, roster flush with players in their primes, and the transfer fees wouldn’t upset those trying to pinch pennies.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
I don’t see a point in selling one of, if not the best player in football history for anything other than a personal reason, even in light of the COVID-19 situation and extortionate wages he commands.
He has no real injury history, is a fitness fanatic and a mentor, shows no signs of slowing down, probably won’t produce much of a capital gain and he still scores goals for fun, not to mention the marketing he brings in for the club.
Assign any other name to that criteria, and unless your club was going under, you’d have to be a madman to sell.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
I think Juve is in a lot of trouble with their finances. The longer this goes the more drastic the measures it will take to keep their head above water.
The players who are likely to move that will provide the largest capital gains are Pjanic (15.323 book value as of 31DEC), Ramsey (3.194), Sandro (8.166), Rabiot (1.298), Rugani (1.174), and De Sciglio (6.071). In truth, the only player that Juve will never see capital gains on is Danilo as he is going to be a money pit for his entire time with the club.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: I’d sell Ramsey, Rabiot and Rugani if I’d had I go as DS

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Title: just getting back after some covid fun
Comment Body: I would expect there to be significantly different rules for this year and FFP etc. If Juve has cash issues that’s another thing entirely, but tbh I wouldn’t be shocked to see another recapitalization.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: From a financial pov you just ruined your squad by selling the most marketable player in the world. It’s like Coca Cola unveiling a growth plan that calls for the sale of Coca Cola (the drink) and replacing them with the rights to Kinnie (google it).

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
In this coronavirus situation, and with no FFP changes, no club, not even the ones you mentioned can afford CR7.
If keeping him tanks the squad and forces the sales of Dybala and/or de Ligt what is the point of him being marketable?

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
de Ligt would be kept – he’s marketable as well. Dybala has been on ‘sale’ for a long time – way before Covid. Also that statement was made on clubs wanting to transfer in Ronaldo. He’s already at Juve so the situation is a bit different for them. In a world where clubs collapse, you want to keep your biggest money magnet and siphon off sponsorships from the fallen.
So yes, CR7 might tank the squad but he’s also the best tool to save the club. If I may indulge in a bit of cynicism, in the midst of this disaster there is an opportunity to jump a few places in the money league. To do that you need pulling power and the initial cash flow to feed it.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: Do you think Dybala is still on ‘sale’? He’s quite marketable, has been of exceptional quality and has shown an eagerness to stay.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: If the club needs money then yes, I think Dybala would be the first on the transfer list, way before Ronaldo.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: Your Juve Champions League bet is safe for the foreseeable future.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: It’s safe for infinity – that squad you put up there had no chance of winning it or any cup but we will never know since the pros would never even consider it. After all CL is not for Juve and vice versa. I believe everyone makes his own destiny, but not Juve, not in the CL

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: Hold on, now. We’ve won it a couple of times, we just don’t like winning it too often.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: first time we won it was in a tragedy-filled stadium, second time was a penalty shootout which is more of a luck

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: How would you rebuild the roster to win Champions League while lowering wages and not spending more than money coming in from transfers?

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: I wouldn’t. Can’t win the Cl by lowering wages as that implies lowering quality. Sure you might get lucky and hit a jackpot with a gamble but you ain’t hitting them all.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
I disagree that lower wages implies lower quality.
Fabian 1.5
Brozovic 3.5
SMS 2.5
etc, etc, etc (I can do this for every position)
Paying a high salary to a mediocre talent doesn’t magically make them better. Juve let their wage bill get away from them and are handcuffed because of it.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
I am speaking overall as in squad wage bill. Also backed by studies – google them.
None of the 3 you mentioned are Juventus material – they are on a Can/Bernardeschi level.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: What world do you live in where Fabian Ruiz is being recruited by Real Madrid, Liverpool, Barcelona, and City, but isn’t Juventus material?

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: We’ll see after he plays for them. Till now he hasn’t done anything special.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: Been a top midfielder in 2 of the 5 best leagues in the world before turning 24, but sure.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: If your definition of a top midfielder is one that plays in a big league, then yes. In that case Juve do not need a top midfielder – they already have many. They need a world class midfielder – now those are a tad scarce.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
My definition of a top player in the league is being among the top 5 players at the position in question. Fabian checks that box in both La Liga and Serie A.
Juve has Bentancur.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: I too am not sold on Fabian – doesn’t look top class to me either

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: The last 6 CL winners all want him. Those types of teams usually go for the middle class players.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
We’ll talk when he actually goes to one of them and after a year. Many of these transfers fail because most players cannot make the psychological jump to a top team. If Fabian Ruiz makes it to an actual top player, then he becomes interesting.
Otherwise, odds are that you end up with a Can or a Bernardeschi or a Diego or a Poulsen etc. That’s one reason why you poach off top teams whenever you can – you get a probable plug-n-play player.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
Yeah I also have my doubts about Fabian Ruiz.
I said so in here about a year ago and received some flack for it.
He has been playing well this year but I wouldn’t say he’s a sure bet. It is true though that lots of big clubs are keen on him.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: Yeah sure. Then I’m Messi, Ronaldo, Platini, Pele and Baggio all rolled in one with a sprinkle of Buffon thrown in.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: Do you look good in black and white?

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
My follow up would be to ask when do they become Juventus material? If the talent they show at Betis and Napoli is the same talent they show at Madrid, Barca, and City weren’t they always Juventus material?
Kante was the same player at Caen that he is now. Wouldn’t it make sense to try and identify and secure those talents so their value increases?
https://en.as.com/en/2020/04/05/football/1586077138_322611.html
I mean look at these idiots seeing the value in their under 20 investments worth double what they paid. They need to have Fabio scouting for them and he can get them sorted out. Who would want those players or funds to be able to build their team? Surely not Juventus.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
Kante was the same player at Caen that he is now. Wouldn’t it make sense to try and identify and secure those talents so their value increases?
Small clubs do that and then sell their investments for double profit. Big clubs have a commercial plan, wait for players to hit peak and then poach by overpaying. So no it does not make sense unless your ambition is to hit a CL QF every 10 years and never win anything.
We have a completely opposite view of what Juve we would like to see. I want a financial juggernaut that does not rely on the sporting element for revenue – a ‘sugar daddy’ club that makes City and PSG look like austerity companies – basically what Juve was before calciopoli. A predatory club that boasts of throwing countless millions at players, just because they can – now that is the real Stile Juventus that I grew up with.
You seem to want an Atalanta or an Ajax – exciting, young, up coming underdogs but with no real ambition beyond feeding the super clubs with great players.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
Yep, those small clubs like Real Madrid and their checks notes 13 Champions League titles. The world has changed and Juve is living in the past and suffering because of it.
How’s that plan working out for Juve? No CL win since 1996 and about to post their largest pre-tax loss since 2012. 3rd worst wages to turnover among the top 15 money league clubs.
I want Juve to be like Real Madrid. They have fuck you money and a plan to keep growing. My ambition is to win CL for the next 15 years while I reload my roster, never having to rebuild it.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
You think Real Madrid is following your path? Really? Damn of all the clubs in the world you claimed Real to be following ‘your’ mantra – those guys with double revenue over Juve.
I also want Juve to be like Real – with 900m revenue and then pay over the odds (from your quote below) for all players while dishing out huge salaries to keep them on the bench.
PS I stopped taking CL seriously a long time ago. Unlike you I remember a time before the hype. If you really want CL wins, my advice would be to start supporting Real.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
In the last 10 years Madrid has bought 5 players over the age of 26 (1 in the last 4 years). That is how you build a team.
LW Eden Hazard – 28 (19/20)
GK Kiko Casilla – 28 (15/16)
GK Keylor Navas – 27 (14/15)
GK Diego Lopez – 31 (12/13)
CB Ricardo Carvalho – 32 (10/11)

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: It’s 33 players over the age of 26 for Juve during that timeframe if you were wondering.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: That’s an interesting comparison

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
Since the 15/16 season:
Madrid spent 663.25 mil
Juve spent 1,001.83 mil
Total spent on transfers over that 10 year period:
Madrid: 1,115.25 mil
Juve: 1,341.33 mil

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
Madrid is going to win 4 titles over the next 10 years because they bought the replacements while they were winning CL 4 out of 5 years.
Real Madrid are starting to capitalise on the young talent they have invested in recently on the field… but also economically. Since they started to pay over the odds for the best young players in the world, the club have shifted their entire philosophy: grab the stars before they become stars.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
They won the 4 out of 5 following the money, some EU taxpayer money out of bank bailouts but still money. Now they are going to win another 4? Easy to say that but it’s all speculation but if they keep their revenue streams ahead of most of the others, they will because money = best players = CL win.
PS – what youth players are you seeing. They have 1 who is on track for becoming Real material – Valverde. That’s it.
PS2 – whose quote is that?

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
Valverde, Asensio, Odergaard, Hakimi, Rodrygo, Reguilon, Vinicius, and Kubo.
And how do they ensure they keep the money rolling in? They buy youth to either insert in their lineup of sell for a massive capital gain.
It’s from the article I linked above.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: I’d keep Dybala as well – he is of the age where his price drops on a monthly basis, plus he’s the next asset after Ronaldo to me

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
Yes I think he is unfortunately.
Definitely should not be

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
I’m surprised he sticks around, what with management seemingly so eager to give him away.
I concur, he should be one of, if not the last name on the transfer sheet. Quality, quantity and loyalty doesn’t come around too often.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: Yeah I’m also surprised he shows so much loyalty without seeming to get it in return

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: Is Kinnie similar to chinotto?

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: Yes it is – both based on oranges.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: Kinnie is better than Chinotto but I am probably biased

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
Colour me intrigued.
The bitterness of Chinotto has a rather large effect on the flavour of food. Is it a quality that remains with Kinnie? and is Kinnie based on a specific variety of orange?
If it is based on a specific variety of orange, can you tell me more about the flavour profiles? Can I make something similar from other varieties of citrus, as Kent (UK) has rather amazing blood oranges.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
It’s supposedly made from bitter orange and extracts of wormwood. The formula is also secret to my knowledge
Once the pandemic is over, you should be able to buy it from some specialised West London stores. Alternatively it should be available on Amazon UK, or it once was.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
Has anyone seen the potential Juventus kit for next season? I think it looks sensational.
Mainly white with gold highlights and three paint brush effect black stripes down the front.
The only problem I see, is that from a two dimensional point of view, it’s a little too white.
Our away kit also looks really nice.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
Man.. I can’t tell you how much I dislike v-necks.
But yeah, the away kit looks great.. except you know, the damned v-neck.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body:
Haha okay I’ve personally found a few more niggles.
The neck material is wider than the central stripe. This irks me a bit, but then again the difference in material between the body and neck of a shirt has always been something that’s irked me, unless there’s a collar attached.
The stripes don’t go all the way to the bottom of the shirt.
The neck is not the same colour as the central stripe.
It doesn’t have a collar.
I still like the shirt, but I want to see a version with a black neck and collar, and the central stripe width matching the neck material width.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: I actually really like V-necks lol

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: Agreed on the v-necks. Damn uncomfortable and ugly to boot.

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: It looks exactly like this year’s Real Madrid kit, the shorts are the same. I like it, but it’s pretty lazy

Article: Report: PSG turns down Miralem Pjanic-Marco Verratti swap deal
Author: Danny Penza
Comment Body: That’s a shame would love Verratti
